greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) (listed antidiagonalwise in order T(1,1), T(2,1), T(1,2), T(3,1), T(2,2), ...) giving the number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n into exactly k powers of 2.
reference: S. Lehr, J. Shallit and J. Tromp, On the vector space of the automatic reals, Theoret. Comput. Sci. 163 (1996), no. 1-2, 193-210.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 1..141, flattened
formula: T(0, k) = T(n, 0) = 0, T(n, k) = 0 if k > n, T(n, 1) = 1 if n = 2^m, 0 otherwise and in other cases T(n, k) = Sum_{i=0..[log2(n-1)]} T(n-(2^i), k-1).
T(n, k)=coefficient of x^n in the formal power series (x+x^2+x^4+x^8+x^16+...)^k. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 04 2005
example: T(6,3) = 4 because there are four ordered partitions of 6 into 3 powers of 2, namely: 4+1+1, 1+4+1, 1+1+4 and 2+2+2 and it is recursively computed from T(5,2)+T(4,2)+T(2,2) = 2+1+1.
maple: seq(seq(T(d-k+1, k), k=1..d), d=1..20);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 26 2014
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := If[k>n, 0, SeriesCoefficient[Sum[x^(2^j), {j, 0, Log[2, n] // Ceiling} ]^k, {x, 0, n}]]; Table[T[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 20}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 06 2015, after _Emeric Deutsch_ *)
xref: The first row is equal to the characteristic function of A000079, i.e. A036987 with offset 1 instead of 0 and the second row is A073267. The column sums give A023359. A073266 gives the upper triangular region of this array.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 25 2002
